item.title: 19 Number | Skhalan | Anamol Mani Poudel - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Unnais nambar and Skhalan
item.description: 19 Number | Skhalan | Anamol Mani Poudel - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. These stories are from Nilima ra Gadha Andhyaro. Nilima ra Gadha Andhyaro is written by Anamol Mani Poudel. Listen Nepali story from Shruti Sambeg on the voice of Achyut Ghimire. Further more you can listen Nepali Novels in Hamro Awaz. listen Unnais nambar and Skhalan by Anamol Mani Poudel. item.title: Aadha Bato - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Aadha Bato - 1
item.description: Aadha Bato - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Aadha Bato Novel is the Nepali Novel written by the Nepali famous and popular writer Krishna Dharabasi. Aadha bato is the autobiography type novel which defined life of the novelist Dharabasi. Krishna has written this novel such a beautiful way that it touches the heart . Listen Nepali Novel Aadha Bato online here from the radio Program Shruti Sambeg with Achyut Ghimire. item.title: Aaja Ramita Cha - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Aaja Ramita Cha part 1
item.description: Aaja Ramita Cha - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Aaja Ramita Cha is written by Famous writer Indra Bahadhur Rai. Nepali Novel Aaja Ramita cha is published firstly in 2032 BS by Sajha Prakashan. Now sixth edition is aviable in Market. This Nepali Novel Aaja Ramita cha is rich in humor, metaphor and colloquialisms. This novel is created in surroundings of Darjeeling. Listen Nepali Novel Aaja Ramita cha from Shruti Sambeg in the voice of Achyut Ghimire. Aaja Ramita Cha part 1 Download Aaja Ramita Cha part 1 Aaja Ramita Cha part 2 Download Aaja Ramita Cha part 2 Aaja Ramita Cha part 3 Download Aaja Ramita Cha part 3 Aaja Ramita Cha part 4 Download Aaja Ramita Cha part 4 Aaja Ramita Cha part 5 Download Aaja Ramita Cha part 5 The Darjeeling of the 1960s is already cosmopolitan in a way that Rai’s contemporaries in Nepal would not have been. In that sense, this novel offers a prescient glimpse into urban Nepali society as it has developed of late in Nepal. On both sides of the border, dreams of greener pastures abound: at one point Janak, returning from a trip to Nepal, chases a peacock he’s glimpsed off the trail to the border. “We humans may have left our own country,” he quips, “but if even the beasts and birds leave, how many days will Nepal remain?” Rai’s Darjeeling is inescapably Nepali, down to the small-town mentalities and the frustrated fatalism. Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

item.title: Aakarharu ra Chhaayaaharu | Nepali Story - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Aakarharu ra Chhaayaaharu
item.description: Aakarharu ra Chhaayaaharu | Nepali Story - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Aakarharu ra Chhaayaaharu is written by Indra Bahadhur Rai. Kathastha is his first Story collection. Listen and download Aakarharu ra Chhaayaaharu from Ujjaalo Network Radio Program Shruti Sambeg with Achyut Ghimire. Rai practiced his own theory of dimensionalism in his short stories written after 1963 from Kathastha, a collection of stories accompanied by a note on his convictions as a dimensionalist was published in 1972. The book has two parts Katha (stories) and Astha (convictions). The texts under Katha section are the examples of the percepts laid down under the Astha section. Aakarharu ra Chhaayaaharu . Download Aakarharu ra Chhaayaaharu from here. Aakarharu ra Chhaayaaharu Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

item.title: Aarli Bhai - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Arli Bhai-Part_1
item.description: Aarli Bhai - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Aarli Bhai is written by Chimkhole Kailaa (Doot Bahadhur Pun). In this book Aarli Bhai collection of stories are included. Listen Aarli Bhai in the voice of Achyut Ghimire from Ujyaalo Network. The stories in this collection cover events in the UK and especially in the Lahure Nepali community. In our Nepali society, even now there is a tendency to shrug one's shoulders about sex and the accompanying sex literature, but in this collection of stories, life is presented artistically. Listen Arli Bhai You can listen Arli Bhai in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Arli Bhai. Full Episodes of Arli Bhai To Download Right Click the link and Save link as to your computer Full Episodes of Arli Bhai Arli Bhai-Part_1 Arli Bhai-Part_2 Arli Bhai-Part_3 The Gurkha army, which has a history of 200 years, has become the culture of Nepali Lahure even though it did not want to, and the story includes the pain of living there, not understanding the culture, environment, rules and regulations and those things. The story also depicts an abstract event within the platoon and a mismatched marriage with a pensioner senior citizen for a better future; Those who have experienced a life that turns this story upside down may feel that these characters are themselves. The book captures the depth of the subject as the author writes the story not by listening but by seeing and experiencing it himself. ' The novel has been collected in the voice of Achyut Ghimire 'Bulbul' in the program "Shrutisambeg". Stories: 1. Early Bhai 2. Nilima Bhanji 3. Santi ko Jindagi 4. Rabin Bhanja 5. Kanchi ko Jindagi 6. Manko Rani Rajani 7. Phoolmati These Audio of Arli Bhai are taken from Archive.org which is uploaded by Shrabya Kitab. Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

The book captures the depth of the subject as the author writes the story not by listening but by seeing and experiencing it himself. ' The novel has been collected in the voice of Achyut Ghimire 'Bulbul' in the program "Shrutisambeg". Stories: 1. Early Bhai 2. Nilima Bhanji 3. Santi ko Jindagi 4. Rabin Bhanja 5. Kanchi ko Jindagi 6. Manko Rani Rajani 7. Phoolmati These Audio of Arli Bhai are taken from Archive.org which is uploaded by Shrabya Kitab. Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

In this book Aarli Bhai collection of stories are included. Listen Aarli Bhai in the voice of Achyut Ghimire from Ujyaalo Network. The stories in this collection cover events in the UK and especially in the Lahure Nepali community. In our Nepali society, even now there is a tendency to shrug one's shoulders about sex and the accompanying sex literature, but in this collection of stories, life is presented artistically. item.title: Abiral Bagdachha Indrawati - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati Intro
item.description: Abiral Bagdachha Indrawati - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Nepali Novel Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati is Written by Ramesh Vikal Flowing is a feature of the river. Because that's his regularity. His character is to kiss the blue of the ocean with the first flow, avoiding the contingency of obstruction. In some rivers, life flows along with the water. In Indravati, the sweat of fishermen and danuvars has been flowing for centuries. And so, its color is pure blue, to this day. Holding Indravati's broken arm in her arms and throwing a net in the daha, playing ruthless Singauri with water, returning the dhuvali, tapping the bait and catching all the fish and ganga as a gift from Indravati from Udayachal to Astachal. Liste Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati in the voice of Khagendra Nepali Listen Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati You can listen Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati. Full Episodes of Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati To Download Right Click the link and Save link as to your computer Full Episodes of Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati Intro Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 1 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 2 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 3 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 4 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 5 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 6 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 7 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 8 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 9 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 10 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 11 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 12 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 13 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 14 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 15 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 16 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 17 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 18 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 19 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 20 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 21 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 22 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 23 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 24 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 25 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 26 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 27 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 28 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 29 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 30 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 31 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 32 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 33 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 34 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 35 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 36 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 37 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 38 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 39 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 40 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 41 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 42 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 43 These Audio of Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati are taken from Archive.org which is uploaded by Shrabya Kitab. When the Sahu-Mahajans do not get bored only after losing their birauta, whether it is snowing the Indravati river or crossing the river to the passers-by in a boat, they save their livelihood. Ramesh Vikal wrote the endless story of the same fishermen who lived a miserable life relying on the same Indravati's neighbors instead of wandering in search of new means of livelihood. 'Aviral Bagdach Indravati' is the same sad story. It is the life of fishermen living from Sipaghat to Dolalghat. Vikal, who has been closely watching the innocent pleas of fishermen to make a living from Sahumahajan, has been struggling to write his stories since the 1930s. And so, Vikal says in the novel, "I looked closely at the life of a fisherman who cries and laughs for the existence of the land on the banks of the river Indravati. That is the gross expression - the novel 'Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati.' "Aviral Bagdach Indravati" is a Nepali language novel written by Ramesh Vikal and brought to the market by Sajha Prakashan. (Source: "Yasri Aviral Bagyo Indravati" Review Baharkhari.com) An audio book version in the voice of Khagendra Nepali has been collected. Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

Nepali Novel Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati is Written by Ramesh Vikal Flowing is a feature of the river. Because that's his regularity. His character is to kiss the blue of the ocean with the first flow, avoiding the contingency of obstruction. In some rivers, life flows along with the water. In Indravati, the sweat of fishermen and danuvars has been flowing for centuries. And so, its color is pure blue, to this day. Holding Indravati's broken arm in her arms and throwing a net in the daha, playing ruthless Singauri with water, returning the dhuvali, tapping the bait and catching all the fish and ganga as a gift from Indravati from Udayachal to Astachal. Liste Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati in the voice of Khagendra Nepali Listen Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati You can listen Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati. Full Episodes of Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati To Download Right Click the link and Save link as to your computer Full Episodes of Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati Intro Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 1 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 2 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 3 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 4 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 5 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 6 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 7 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 8 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 9 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 10 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 11 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 12 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 13 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 14 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 15 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 16 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 17 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 18 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 19 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 20 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 21 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 22 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 23 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 24 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 25 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 26 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 27 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 28 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 29 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 30 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 31 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 32 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 33 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 34 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 35 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 36 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 37 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 38 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 39 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 40 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 41 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 42 Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati part 43 These Audio of Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati are taken from Archive.org which is uploaded by Shrabya Kitab. When the Sahu-Mahajans do not get bored only after losing their birauta, whether it is snowing the Indravati river or crossing the river to the passers-by in a boat, they save their livelihood. Ramesh Vikal wrote the endless story of the same fishermen who lived a miserable life relying on the same Indravati's neighbors instead of wandering in search of new means of livelihood. 'Aviral Bagdach Indravati' is the same sad story. It is the life of fishermen living from Sipaghat to Dolalghat. Vikal, who has been closely watching the innocent pleas of fishermen to make a living from Sahumahajan, has been struggling to write his stories since the 1930s. And so, Vikal says in the novel, "I looked closely at the life of a fisherman who cries and laughs for the existence of the land on the banks of the river Indravati. That is the gross expression - the novel 'Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati.' "Aviral Bagdach Indravati" is a Nepali language novel written by Ramesh Vikal and brought to the market by Sajha Prakashan. (Source: "Yasri Aviral Bagyo Indravati" Review Baharkhari.com) An audio book version in the voice of Khagendra Nepali has been collected. Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

In Indravati, the sweat of fishermen and danuvars has been flowing for centuries. And so, its color is pure blue, to this day. Holding Indravati's broken arm in her arms and throwing a net in the daha, playing ruthless Singauri with water, returning the dhuvali, tapping the bait and catching all the fish and ganga as a gift from Indravati from Udayachal to Astachal. When the Sahu-Mahajans do not get bored only after losing their birauta, whether it is snowing the Indravati river or crossing the river to the passers-by in a boat, they save their livelihood. Ramesh Vikal wrote the endless story of the same fishermen who lived a miserable life relying on the same Indravati's neighbors instead of wandering in search of new means of livelihood. 'Aviral Bagdach Indravati' is the same sad story. It is the life of fishermen living from Sipaghat to Dolalghat. Vikal, who has been closely watching the innocent pleas of fishermen to make a living from Sahumahajan, has been struggling to write his stories since the 1930s. And so, Vikal says in the novel, "I looked closely at the life of a fisherman who cries and laughs for the existence of the land on the banks of the river Indravati. That is the gross expression - the novel 'Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati.' "Aviral Bagdach Indravati" is a Nepali language novel written by Ramesh Vikal and brought to the market by Sajha Prakashan. (Source: "Yasri Aviral Bagyo Indravati" Review Baharkhari.com) An audio book version in the voice of Khagendra Nepali has been collected. item.description: Abiral Bagdachha Indrawati - Episode 43 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Nepali Novel Abiral Bagdacha Indrawati is Written by Ramesh Vikal Flowing is a feature of the river. Because that's his regularity. His character is to kiss the blue of the ocean with the first flow, avoiding the contingency of obstruction. In some rivers, life flows along with the water. In Indravati, the sweat of fishermen and danuvars has been flowing for centuries. And so, its color is pure blue, to this day. Holding Indravati's broken arm in her arms and throwing a net in the daha, playing ruthless Singauri with water, returning the dhuvali, tapping the bait and catching all the fish and ganga as a gift from Indravati from Udayachal to Astachal. item.description: Abstract Chintan Pyaj - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Abstract Chintan Pyaaz is written by Sankar Lamichhane. Abstract Chintan Pyaj won Madan Puraskar in 2024 Bs. From this creation Sankar Lamichhane become so popular in Nepali Literature. Sankar Lamichhane is the great writer that reader find him very interesting on his creation. Among his creation Pyaj, Pidhalu are really great. Listen Abstract Chintan Pyaj by Sankar Lamichhane with great voice of Achyut Ghimire from the radio program Shruti Sambeg. Abstract Chintan Pyaaz Listen Dautako Kaam Tarapunja Aandha ko Braille, Pendulum Oscillation Pendulum : Samjhana ka layama bilin hudai and Aalubakhada ki Aau : Hami Paitala Hau Fagat Paitala with Achyut. item.description: Antarman ko Yatra - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Antarman Ko Yatra Written by Jagadish Ghimire. Antarman Ko Yatra is Awarded by Uttam Sahitya Puraskar and Madan Puraskar. It was first published in 2064 BS. This Audio version is on voice Achyut Ghimire on the program Shruti Sambeg. After Antarman ko Yatra, writer Jagadish Ghimire wrote Nepali Novel Sakash. item.description: Arki Aimai - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Arki Aimai is written by Neelam Karki Niharika. The beginning of the novel begins with the main character's visit to Nepal and ends in Nepal. The storyline is moving forward through storytelling style. Another autobiographical woman novel depicts the difficult life of a woman. The novel is presented in a flash bank style and the curiosity, which is considered to be a strong aspect of fiction, is meticulously fulfilled by the novelist. But somewhere out of curiosity they are interrupted. The novel explores the American immigrant lifestyle and various incidents of human trafficking that take place there. Arki Aimai is written by Neelam Karki Niharika. Listen Nepali Novel Arki Aimai with Achyut Ghimire from Shruti Sambeg. Listen Arki Aimai You can listen Arki Aimai in Hamro Awaz. The novel shows the reality that America is a country of dreams and America is also a country of struggle. The novel shows the compulsion of the immigrants who can't live without work and have to work there from immoral to illegal. Showing the real life style of immigrants in America, the novel captures the aspirations of those who have arrived and want to reach there through various characters. She wrote Story Mohachakra in 2050, Sunyabat 2058. These Nepali stories are published in many Magazines. Nepali Story Arko Jeevan is about a Girl Rajani. Rajani girl with great talent. This story is around the topic of Handicap. Listen Nepali Story Arko Jeevan Writer Hiranya Kumari Pathak described the story of a girl Rajani. Autobiography China Harayeko Manchhe is written by Popular Actor Hari Bamsa Acharya. Haribamsa Acharya is an Actor, Writer, Director and Social Worker. Since China Harayeko Manche Novel is not recorded to audio format till today. It is Illegal to provide an audio Version of China Harayeko Manche. Madan Krishna Shrestha and Hari Bamsha Acharya are one of the best actor of Nepal. Madan Krishna Shrestha has also published his autobiography in name of Maha Ko Ma. Listen Maha Ko Ma audio version written by Madan Krishna Shrestha. Even though you can find novel download link here. Just you have to find novel of your choice. So one has to Buy the book China Harayeko Manchhe or to find download link for China Harayeko Manchhe to know what was happened in the biography of Hari bamsa Acharya. Audio of China Harayeko Manche are good for listen and download. Thank you. Nepali Novels provide you more Nepali Novels to listen famous and popular Nepali Novels. item.title: Chuki | Nepali Story - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Listen Chuki
item.description: Chuki | Nepali Story - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Chuki, a name of a girl with a children who become widow on the Maoist period. Husband of Chuki worked on Nepal Army. During Maoist war He was killed by Maoist. Later a two years younger boy "Saroj" get attracted with her and this story Chuki is on this subject matter. Chuki is Nepali Story written by Bina Tamang "Sungava". Chuki is her first Story collection. In this story Tamang has described the condition of Nepal in Moaist period. Listen and download Story Chuki form Ujyaalo 90 Network program Shruti sambeg with Achyut Ghimire. Listen Chuki . Download Comrade Anjana and Chuki from here. Download Chuki Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

item.title: Chuli - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Chuli-Part_1
item.description: Chuli - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Chuli is witten by Famous Nepali Writer Saru Bhakta. Saru Bhakta has written many Novels for Nepali Literature. Among them Pagal Basti, Samaya Trasadi, Taruni Kheti are most popular novel. The 'Chuli', which does not seem to be more inconsistent than the history of mountaineering, is in fact a place of human jealousy and toxins. The adventure campaign is well documented. The courage to accept the challenge of climbing, the thrilling experience of the Everest climbers and the lively account of the wonderful experience is interesting and fascinating. Not only from the point of view of painting a natural image, but also the experience of the monstrosity, risk, accident, imminent death, etc. of Everest. And the geography of Mount Everest, the history of the ascent, the technical knowledge about it, the atmospheric pressure, the tools used in the ascent, the names of the inaccessible places, etc. Listen Audio version of Chuli from Ujyaalo network in the voice of Achyut Ghimire. Listen Chuli You can listen Chuli in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Chuli. Full Episodes of Chuli To Download Right Click the link and Save link as to your computer Full Episodes of Chuli Chuli-Part_1 Chuli-Part_2 Chuli-Part_3 The 70-page novel is about a climber climbing Mt. Everest. Although the novel takes the reader on a journey through the furnace, it is essentially a statement of the furnace of life. Philosophical characters and poetic sweetness have the power to captivate the mind and brain in the place of the book like the snow that blows to cover the eyes of the climber during the ascent. In the introduction, Krishnachandra Singh Pradhan has called this short novel an 'essay of prose poetic experiences'. Everest stands as a peak full of unwavering self-confidence, dedication, curiosity and hope. This Everest is the ego of man, the sense of life. The journey to Chuli can also be taken as a whole life journey. ‘There are risks in the mountains. There are mountains in life. Life is a beautiful poem of risks, ”said Arohi, who is inspired to play with the challenges of life. Even if it is physically like a snowball, in essence, it is the central voice of the work that should be considered as the goal of life and success. The mountaineer who walks from Namche walks to the top of Mt. Everest alone without any guide or other helper. Proud to have climbed all the mountains of life alone, he said, "The journey to Chuli is always a lonely journey." Even though the inclement weather has become a ghost to frighten life and travel, its purpose is to shield it even in adverse conditions. "It simply came to our notice then. Life without purpose is death. Death is not a purpose. 'Saying, the climber always pushes to stop, get tired, freeze. Surprisingly, the author, who has never climbed Mt. Everest, visually illustrates every step of the way. This is the height of the writer's power and imagination. Although Lhotse, Nupche, Changte, Khumbatse and Pumori stoves can be seen from the base camp, we know that Mount Everest is not visible. For me, having only seen / touched snow and hail in the name of snow in my life, the risk of climbing the stove and wrestling with snow that earns my heart grows thorns in the side. Snow and snow are different things, and snow and mountains are different things. He takes the porters to the base camp at an altitude of 5300 meters at the foot of Khumbu Ice Fruit. "There was no loss of life in the expedition, only a few porters died," he said. Humanism is his weapon, like an avalanche that has to be buried in the rocky snow. With the longing to fill the deepest pit of sorrow, the porters at the foot of the highest peak feel different strands of sorrow in themselves. There are six porters in the base camp who are forced to pay for the treatment of their sick father, who have been deceived to teach their children, and who have run to Ranaha to meet the needs of the household. In order to stop him, he shares the citamole of the philosophy that 'there is sorrow in life, but life is not sorrow'. Reminding the fellow traveler of the simplicity of life, can he advance his ascent in a straight line? Can he consciously end that journey by saying, 'The journey of the stove is not the journey of unconsciousness'? These Audio of Chuli are taken from Archive.org which is uploaded by Shrabya Kitab. Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

item.title: Cleopatra - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Cleopatra Novel Episode 1
item.description: Cleopatra - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Cleopatra is the World famous novel. Cleopatra was translated to Nepali language and the audio version of Nepali Novel can be listen through the radio Program Shruti Sambeg on Achyut Ghimire's voice. Beside you can listen many famous and popular Nepali Novels on this blog, enjoy listening Nepali Novels. Cleopatra: Being an Account of the Fall and Vengeance of Harmachis is a novel written by the author H. Rider Haggard the author of King Solomon's Mines and She.The book was first printed in 1889.The story is set in the Ptolemaic era of Ancient Egyptian history and revolves around the survival of a Dynasty bloodline protected by the Priesthood of Isis. The main character Harmachis (the living descendant of this Bloodline) is charged by the Priesthood to overthrow the supposed imposter Cleopatra, drive out the Romans and restore Egypt to its Golden era. item.title: Darbar Bahiraki Maharani - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Darbar Bahiraki Maharani Part 1
item.description: Darbar Bahiraki Maharani - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Darbar Bahiraki Maharani Darbar Bahiraki Maharani is Nepali Novel written by Nagendra Neupane. Darbar Bahiraki Maharani is Novel about the King Mahendra Bir Bikram Shah and Gita who worked in Palace when Mahendra was Prince. This Novel has described the physical relationship between Prine Mahendra and Geeta. This love affair gave birth to Mahendra's first son Rabindra. Rabindra was considered as unauthorised Prince in palace. But later on neither Rabindra was introduced as authorised prince nor his mother Geeta was introduced as authorised King. This Novel Darbar Bahiraki Maharani is in audio version and read out by Achyut Ghimire. This audio novel is taken from radio program Shruti Sambeg. Shruti Sambeg is radio program about Nepali Novels from Ujjyalo 90 FM (UNN 90) Moreover you can listen book related to Nepalese Shah Dynasty Novel and book. Listen audio version of Maile Dekheko Darbar related to King Mahendra and read book Tribhuvan Ki Erika Listen Darbar Bahiraki Maharani Listen Darbar Bahiraki Maharani You can listen Darbar Bahiraki Maharani in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Darbar Bahiraki Maharani. Listen Darbar Bahiraki Maharani with Achyut Ghimire from the Radio program Shruti Sambeg. item.title: Darbar Bahiraki Maharani - Episode 12
item.itunes:subtitle: Darbar Bahiraki Maharani Part 12
item.description: Darbar Bahiraki Maharani - Episode 12 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Darbar Bahiraki Maharani Darbar Bahiraki Maharani is Nepali Novel written by Nagendra Neupane. Darbar Bahiraki Maharani is Novel about the King Mahendra Bir Bikram Shah and Gita who worked in Palace when Mahendra was Prince. This Novel has described the physical relationship between Prine Mahendra and Geeta. This love affair gave birth to Mahendra's first son Rabindra. Rabindra was considered as unauthorised Prince in palace. But later on neither Rabindra was introduced as authorised prince nor his mother Geeta was introduced as authorised King. This Novel Darbar Bahiraki Maharani is in audio version and read out by Achyut Ghimire. This audio novel is taken from radio program Shruti Sambeg. Shruti Sambeg is radio program about Nepali Novels from Ujjyalo 90 FM (UNN 90) Moreover you can listen book related to Nepalese Shah Dynasty Novel and book. item.title: Faliyeko Saman - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Faliyeko Saman Part 1
item.description: Faliyeko Saman - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Faliyeko Saman is written by Tarini Prasad Koirala. Faliyeko Saman is publshed by oriental publication. Tarini Prasad Koirala was story writer, politician, novelist. He wrote the stories and novel during 2017 BS to 2023 BS during 6 years jail life. His wrote novel Sarpadamsa, Faliyeko Saman, Rato Sweater, Agnibatika, Naini. Among them Sarpadamsa and Agnibatika are already included before in Hamro Awaz. Listen other creation of Tarini Prasad Koirala Agni Batika Listen Faliyeko Saman with Achyut Ghimire from radio program Shruti Sambeg. Listen Faliyeko Saman You can listen Faliyeko Saman in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Faliyeko Saman. Listen Faliyeko Saman with Achyut Ghimire from the Radio program Shruti Sambeg. item.description: Faliyeko Saman - Episode 13 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Faliyeko Saman is written by Tarini Prasad Koirala. Faliyeko Saman is publshed by oriental publication. Tarini Prasad Koirala was story writer, politician, novelist. He wrote the stories and novel during 2017 BS to 2023 BS during 6 years jail life. His wrote novel Sarpadamsa, Faliyeko Saman, Rato Sweater, Agnibatika, Naini. Among them Sarpadamsa and Agnibatika are already included before in Hamro Awaz. Listen other creation of Tarini Prasad Koirala Agni Batika Listen Faliyeko Saman with Achyut Ghimire from radio program Shruti Sambeg. Listen Faliyeko Saman You can listen Faliyeko Saman in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Faliyeko Saman. Listen Faliyeko Saman with Achyut Ghimire from the Radio program Shruti Sambeg. Franceli Premi is translated by Bibek Sharma. This is not Nepali Novel, Its translated form of famous Foreign Novel. Franseli Premi on this blog is in Audio version ie audio book and its in the voice of Achyut Ghimire from the UNN 90 Network program Shruti Sambeg. Shruti Sambeg is Radio Program on Nepali Novel. item.title: Gham Ka Paila Haru - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Gham ka Paila haru Part 1
item.description: Gham Ka Paila Haru - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Gham Ka Paila Haru Novel is written by Dhanus Chandra Gotame. Dhanus Chandra Gotame is writer of Kalantar, Gham ka Paila haru, Uttarottar. Gham ka Paila haru is winner of Madan Puraskar and sajha Puraskar of 2035 B.S. This novel is about the life style of Tarai. This novel described the situation of tarai in the time of rana prime minister Chandra Sumser in Amlekhgunj. Listen Gham Ka Paila haru from Sunne lai sunko mala with Pawan Raj Poudel. Listen Gham Ka Paila Haru You can listen Gham Ka Paila Haru in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Gham Ka Paila Haru. item.title: Gularko Phool - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Gularko Phool Part 1
item.description: Gularko Phool - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Nepali Novel Gularko Phool is written by Madhav Pyakurel and published by Oriental Publication. This Nepali Novel is about Gandak Treaty between Nepal and India ie Nepal Bharat bich Gandak Samjhauta. This Nepali novel describes the situation of formation of Panchayat system in Nepal ie panchayat ko Bijaropan, Narayani Nadi ma Gandak Byarej, Padchapka aawaazharu, Bataska jhokkale tarangit chhalharu, bacherako halal, machha machha Bhayaguta, gaunmaa anistako sanket, Tilak Chadab, khamchangkhumchung pareko bhakari and 33 titled subjects. These places are indicated in maps in books. Writer has described the condition in heart touching way. Listen the audio version of Nepali Novel from the radio program Shruti sambeg with the voice of Achyut Ghimire. These places are indicated in maps in books. Writer has described the condition in heart touching way. Listen the audio version of Nepali Novel from the radio program Shruti sambeg with the voice of Achyut Ghimire. item.description: Hajur Aama Ko Katha - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Hajur Aama ka Katha is written by Amrita Lamsal. This book is collection of story from Grandmothers. This book contains the story about many women who become grand mother. Hajur Aama Ka Katha include the story of 23 grandmothers and three stories of grand child are also included in this book. Listen Nepali Stories Hajur Aama ka Katha from shruti sambeg with Achyut Ghimire. Listen Hajur Aama Ka Katha You can listen Hajur Aama Ka Katha in Hamro Awaz. Jhola can be considered as the story rather than the novel. Jhola is all about the eternal connection of love between mother and son. Krishna Dharabasi has defined the details of the Sati Pratha on the story Jhola. This is the Heart touching story. If you really love your mother then the novel will make your eyes watery. item.title: Lal Chudi | Krishna Abiral - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Lal Chudi Part 1
item.description: Lal Chudi | Krishna Abiral - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Nepali Novel Lal Chudi is written by Krishna Abiral. Lal Chudi is story about the Dowry "Dahej Pratha". Dowry System prevails in Mid Tarai. Lal Chudi is about the lady Jyoti. This Nepali Novel is point out the problem of female in underdeveloped country. This is the story of Female named Jyoti from the Terai region. Krishna Abiral presented his talency of literature from this Novel. Lal Chudi figure out the present situation of female and their parents. Female have to go through tough stage in their life. The writing style of Abiral added life in the Novel Lal Chudi. Listen Nepali Novel Lal Chudi from Shruti Sambeg in the voice of Achyut Ghimire. Shruti Sambeg is Radio program from Ujjyalo 90 Network. Lal Chudi is story about the Dowry "Dahej Pratha". Dowry System prevails in Mid Tarai. Lal Chudi is about the lady Jyoti. This Nepali Novel is point out the problem of female in underdeveloped country. This is the story of Female named Jyoti from the Terai region. Krishna Abiral presented his talency of literature from this Novel. Lal Chudi figure out the present situation of female and their parents. Female have to go through tough stage in their life. The writing style of Abiral added life in the Novel Lal Chudi. Listen Nepali Novel Lal Chudi from Shruti Sambeg in the voice of Achyut Ghimire. Shruti Sambeg is Radio program from Ujjyalo 90 Network. She wrote Story Mohachakra in 2050, Sunyabat 2058. These Nepali stories are published in many Magazines. Nepali Story Living Together is about a Girl Geeta and her husband Rajesh. This story describes female mentality of the modern time. Listen Nepali Story Living Together Writer Hiranya Kumari Pathak described the story of a girl Geeta and her Husband Rajesh. item.title: Lu - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Listen Lu by Nayan Raj Pandey part 1
item.description: Lu - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Lu Novel is written by Nepali Novelist Nayan Raj Pandey. In this book Loo, Nayan Raj Pandey has defined about the society where Nepalese and Indian live together. The story defines the situation of Nepalese where being Nepalese people are able to live as Nepalese. The story is about the Nepali land with Indian Market. The story defies the problems that the people are facing in the boarder area. Lu Novel | Nayan Raj Pandey LU Novel is about the place called Patharpurawa. He has defined the situation of the Patharpurawa in this story Loo. Listen the Audio version of Lu by Nayan Raj Pandey. This Audio version is taken from "Sunnelai Sunko Mala" in the crystal clear voice of Pawan Raj Poudel. Listen Lu by Nayan Raj Pandey part 1 . Lu by Nayan Raj Pandey Part 2 . item.title: Mantha Darayeko Juug - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Mantha Darayeko Jug - 01
item.description: Mantha Darayeko Juug - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Mantha Darayeko Jug is written by Mohan Mainali. This book shows the situation of the time during Maoist time in Nepal. This book contains the situation of people and society of Nepal during 10 years of Maoist civil war in Nepal . Mantha Darayeko Jug describes the story of the people of that time who lost their life and their family members. This book also contains story of the people who lost their beloved and managed to live in the difficult situation during war. This book Mantha Darayeko Jug is the live picture from the point of view from Journalist Mohan Mainali. Mohan Mainali is the famous journalist , writer of Uppallo, Mantha Darayeko Jug and also director of Jogimara ka Jyuda haru. Listen Mantha Darayeko Jug from radio program Shruti Sambeg with Achyut Ghimire with technical support of Sachindra Gautam. Listen Mantha Darayeko Jug You can listen Mantha Darayeko Jug in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Mantha Darayeko Jug. This book shows the situation of the time during Maoist time in Nepal. This book contains the situation of people and society of Nepal during 10 years of Maoist civil war in Nepal . Mantha Darayeko Jug describes the story of the people of that time who lost their life and their family members. This book also contains story of the people who lost their beloved and managed to live in the difficult situation during war. This book Mantha Darayeko Jug is the live picture from the point of view from Journalist Mohan Mainali. item.title: Meera - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Meera part 1
item.description: Meera - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Deepak Sinjali's first Nepali novel 'Meera' (Mira) has been released in Pokhara. Narrator Bhuvan Hari Sigdel unveiled the novel at a program organized by Pokhareli Youth Cultural Family. Sigdel said that the path of philosophy has been strengthened in Mira. Listen Nepali Novel Meera from crystal clear voice of Achyut Ghimire from Radio Program Shruti Sambeg from Unn Ujyaalo 90 network. Sigdel said that even though the love between the brothers and sisters seemed to be complicated, there was no bond between them. He also argued that the debate should not be dragged out. Novelist Deepak Sinjali had said that he had written to present social justice system, love and life saving. The novelist Sinjali said that he was of the opinion that social structures such as bone marrow relations should be resolved by law or accepted. Publisher Shikha Books' Pushparaj Poudel also extended best wishes at the program chaired by family chairman Deepak Samip. The program was conducted by Secretary Arjun Adhikari. Listen Meera You can listen Meera in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Meera. item.title: Naughreko June - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Naughreko Jun part 1
item.description: Naughreko June - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Naughreko June is written by Janu Kambang Limbu . Reviewing the collection of stories, Thing said that she found all the stories of 'Naughreko June' to be realistic, written on social grounds. Dr. Rai mentioned that Janu's songs were awful. Chairperson of the Nepali Literary Council Shashi Limbu, Secretary Tika Chamling and General Secretary of the Lyricists Association Shubh Mukharung also spoke on the occasion. The collection contains 20 stories and 10 songs in the album. Explaining that there is always work to be done in a foreign country, the creator said that she used to write on her mobile phone while traveling by train or train. Listen Naughreko Jun You can listen Naughreko Jun in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Naughreko Jun. item.title: Nihau Namaste - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Nihau Nameste part 1
item.description: Nihau Namaste - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Nihau Namaste is written by Lakshmi Lamsal 'Lakshmi Puja' The Belt and Road Initiative put forward by China could benefit Nepal and the world. This shows Chinese railway stories, the Chinese people's perception of Nepal and China's poverty alleviation formulas. Nihau Namaste is written by Lakshmi Lamsal. Listen Nihau Nameste with Achyut Ghimire from Shruti Sambeg. The book also mentions the family life of the outgoing Chinese President Xi Jinping. Listen Nihau Nameste You can listen Nihau Nameste in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Nihau Nameste. Full Episodes of Nihau Nameste To Download Right Click the link and Save link as to your computer Full Episodes of Nihau Nameste Nihau Nameste part 1 Nihau Nameste part 2 Nihau Nameste part 3 Nihau Nameste part 4 These Audio of Nihau Nameste are taken from Archive.org which is uploaded by Shrabya Kitab. Nepal-China relations are old and the historical characters who have contributed to the inland relations are Manjushree, Songchan Gampo, Bhrukuti, Araniko, Chinese and Nepali travelers, Chinese leaders of the then kings of Nepal, Mao Tsetung, Chauen Lai, Chiang Cha Min and others. The book also proposes that traditional relations can add a new dimension to inland relations by standing on the characters of history. The author, who has been working as a radio journalist in Beijing, China for the past six years, recounts his experiences in this book. The book also attempts to convey a sense of direct experience to Nepalis unfamiliar with China through a number of articles. The world-famous Great Wall, the role of numbers in Chinese life, traditional medicine, martial arts (acrobatics), Chinese food culture, some of the similarities between Nepal and China, and the Chinese Pem Life will instantly make readers aware of China. The cover of the book also shows a Chinese hand and a Nepali hand joining hands to greet the symbol of the bound path in the background. One of them has a Chinese flag on one hand and a Nepali flag on the other. Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

item.title: Ojhel - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Ojhel part 1
item.description: Ojhel - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Nepali Novel Ojhel is written by Jeevan Khadka. Ozel is a novel based on the story of contemporary themes. It tells the story of love and separation between a young man who came to the city from a village and a young woman who came to Nepal from Germany. Although a novel based on love, Ojhel depicts the problems of Haliya and Kamaiya in western Nepal from the depiction of social norms and conflict. The problem of suffering has become readable as this novel speaks. Although it is a love novel, it is connected to society. Listen Nepali Novel Ojhel by Jeevan Khadka with Achyut Ghimire from Shruti Sambeg. Listen Ojhel You can listen Ojhel in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Ojhel. Full Episodes of Ojhel To Download Right Click the link and Save link as to your computer Full Episodes of Ojhel Ojhel part 1 Ojhel part 2 Ojhel part 3 Ojhel part 4 These Audio of Ojhel are taken from Archive.org which is uploaded by Shrabya Kitab. The novel discusses the plight of a young man who enters the city from a village with a dream, depicts political anarchy, and the exploitation of women accused of witchcraft. There is also a depiction of the conflict-era events and their impact on Nepali society. As the event of Prithvinarayan Shah's unification is depicted, this work also tries to show the historical information easily and clearly. In this novel, depiction of nature, figurative presentation, simplicity of language, subject matter have come easily. This book has managed to be very close to life. The novel has been collected in the voice of Achyut Ghimire in the program "Shruti Sambeg". Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

item.title: Paribhasit Aakhaharu - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Paribhasit Aakhaharu part 1
item.description: Paribhasit Aakhaharu - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Paribhasit Aakhaharu श्रुति संवेगको शुक्रबारको श्रृंखलामा हामी पारिजातको उपन्यास “परिभाषित आँखाहरु” श्रृंखलाबद्ध रुपमा सुनाउँदै जाने छौं । पारिजातको खास नाम विष्णुकुमारी वाइबा हो । उहाँले परिभाषित आँखाहरु वि.सं. २०४६ सालमा लेख्नुभएको थियो । पारिजातको जन्म सन् १९३७ मा भारतको दार्जिलिंगमा भएको थियो । Paribhasit Aakhaharu part 1 . Download Paribhasit Aakhaharu by Parijat part 1 Paribhasit Aakhaharu part 2 . Download Paribhasit Aakhaharu by Parijat part 2 Paribhasit Aakhaharu part 3 . Download Paribhasit Aakhaharu by Parijat part 3 Paribhasit Aakhaharu part 4 . Download Paribhasit Aakhaharu by Parijat part 4 Paribhasit Aakhaharu part 5 . Download Paribhasit Aakhaharu by Parijat part 5 Paribhasit Aakhaharu part 6गएको साता उपन्यास परिभाषित आँखाहरुको पाँचौं श्रृंखलामा बिनोद यादवले बिज्जीप्रति कुनै दया राखेन । उसको षड्यन्त्रको चंगुलबाट बिज्जीले बाहिर निस्की । रछ्यानबाट उठेकी बिज्जी फेरि रछ्यानमै पुगेकी छ । राजधानीको एक घरमा एउटी गृहिणीले शरण दिएकी छ बिज्जीलाई । अब आजबाट उपन्यासको दोश्रो प्रवाहको वाचन शुरु हुँदैछ । उपन्यास वाचन सुन्दा तपाईंलाई कथावस्तु अन्तै मोडिए जस्तो पनि लाग्न सक्छ । तर हामी यसै उपन्यासमा छौं । . Download Paribhasit Aakhaharu by Parijat episode 6 Paribhasit Aakhaharu part 7 १० कक्षा पढ्ने वसंतिया र उसलाई पढाउने राजन सर बीच बिहाको तयारी हुदैछ ! . Download Paribhasit Aakhaharu by Parijat episode 7 Paribhasit Aakhaharu part 8 वसंतिया र राजन सरको कथा आएपछि बिज्ज़ी ओझेल परेकी जस्ती भई । तर "परिभाषित आँखाहरु" को मुख्य पात्र बिज्ज़ी नै हो र सबैको खोजि उहीप्रति छ । आज आउँछे बिज्ज़ी, प्रतिक्ष्या गर्नुहोस । . Download Paribhasit Aakhaharu by Parijat episode 8 Paribhasit Aakhaharu part 9 . Download Paribhasit Aakhaharu by Parijat episode 9 Paribhasit Aakhaharu part 10 पत्थर रसाउंछ, आकाश रुनेछ, संसारमा कयामत आउनेछ । आज बिज्जी, बसन्तीya र राजन सरको कथा पढ्ने कसरी ? म साह्स जुटाउंदैछु (अच्युत घिमिरे) . Download Paribhasit Aakhaharu by Parijat episode 10 Paribhasit Aakhaharu part 11 (Last Episode) . Download Paribhasit Aakhaharu by Parijat episode 11 Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

item.title: Radha - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Radha Part 1
item.description: Radha - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Nepali Upanyash :- Radha Writer :- Krishna Dharabasi Programme : Shruti Sambeg (Ujjyallo 90 Network) RJ :- Achyut Ghimire Radha Written by Krishna Dharabasi It's been two years since Krishna Dharabasi wrote Radha, an extraordinary novel, and yet, the novel is still relatively unknown among litterateurs and the general public. Radha is a strong example of a novelist challenging traditional mores by presenting mythical texts in a different light. Inspired by Jacques Derrida's Theory of Deconstruction, he has completely changed the characters of Radha and Krishna as we have come to know them. Ved Vyas' and the Mahabharat's Radha is a minor character, whose only purpose seems to be Krishna's plaything. But Dharabasi's Radha is brave, dignified and can also be seen as a revolutionary. He keeps focusing on the importance of women, which too can be seen as a challenge to formal traditions. Krishna Dharabasi won the Nepal's prestigious Literary Award Madan Puraskar from this Novel Radha. Listen Radha Online Play the episodes of Radha by Krishna Dharabasi and enjoy listening Radha. item.title: Red Square - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Red Square - Part 01
item.description: Red Square - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Krishna Dharabasi has written many novels in Nepalese Literature representing Nepalese society. "Krishna Dharabasi" is one of the most popular writer of Nepal. The actual name of Krishna Dharabasi is Krishna Prasad Bhattarai. Krishna Dharabasi was born in Amarpur Villege of Panchthar District, Nepal on 1960. As he is son of Tikaram Bhattarai, teacher of Amarpur Dhule School as well as Astrologer, he got good opportunity for study in his childhood. Dharabasi's mother Ambika Bhattarai was a housewife. Due to some Family problem Krishna's family moved to Jhapa District in 1967. As his grandparents neglected them Krishna's family has to go through poverty and shortage in childhood. Though Dharabasi continued his study and passed SLC in 1977 and completed Bachelor's Degree in Business Studies. Red Square is expedition book of Russia from 9 June 2012 to 12 July. Listen Red Square You can listen Red Square in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Red Square. item.title: Sabiti - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Sabiti Novel-Part_1
item.description: Sabiti - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Sabiti Novel is written by Jagadish Ghimire. Jagadish Ghimire become famous in Nepali literature after his creation "Lilaam" published in BS 2027. Lilaam was one of the best creation of that time which was written on the favor of the people. So the Panchyat Government pointed him. That's why publishing Sabiti become bit difficult for Jagadish Ghimire. This novel is in audio format. Audio format of Sabiti novel is taken from Shruti Sambeg in the crystal clear voice of Achyut Ghimire with technical support Sangharsha Bista. Sakas, Antarman Ko Yatra are also written by Mandan Puraskar winner Writer Jagadish Ghimire. Unko Samjhana written by Durga Ghimire (Wife of Jagadish Ghimire) is novel for the tribute to Jagadish Ghimire. Listen Sabiti Novel and enjoy. Listen Sabiti Novel You can listen Sabiti Novel in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Sabiti Novel. item.itunes:subtitle: Sanskar and Bhoot
item.description: Sanskar | Bhoot | Rajendra Bimal ka Kathaharu - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Sanskar and Bhoot is from Story collection Rajendra Bimal ka Katha Haru. Rajendra Bimal Ka Katha Haru is written by Dr. Rajendra Bimal. This story collection is published by Bagar Foundation Nepal. Listen Nepali Story Sanskar and Bhoot from Shruti Sambeg. Nepali Story Sanskar is about Hindu Women and it describes the culture of Hindu female. Listen Story Sanskar by Rajendra Bimal. Similarly Nepali Story Bhoot is about descrimination of Tarai region. This story describes the condition of Terai Region. Listen Nepali audio Stories from Shruti Sambeg. Listen Nepali Story Sanskar and Bhoot Listen to audio Nepali Novel Likhe by Sarad Poudel in the voice of Achyut Ghimire. Likhe Novel presents different Subject matter of society. Sanskar and Bhoot Download Sanskar | Bhoot Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

item.title: Sarsarti Sansar - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Sarsarti Sansar Part 1
item.description: Sarsarti Sansar - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Sarsarti Sansar is written by Jiba Lamichhane. Sarsarti Sansar is the travelogue published by Nepalaya in 2017. "Sarsarti Sansar is a light-hearted book that encapsulates my individual experiences and feelings invoked by different places I traveled to. I got to travel to various places during the course of my studies and career. So, in this book, I have tried to capture and condense all the memories of the places." - Jiba Lamichhane Listen Sarsarti Sansar You can listen Sarsarti Sansar in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Sarsarti Sansar. Listen Sarsarti Sansar with Achyut Ghimire from the Radio program Shruti Sambeg. Full Episodes of Sarsarti Sansar To Download Right Click the link and Save link as to your computer Full Episodes of Sarsarti Sansar Sarsarti Sansar Part 1 Sarsarti Sansar Part 2 Sarsarti Sansar Part 3 Sarsarti Sansar Part 4 Sarsarti Sansar Part 5 Sarsarti Sansar Part 6 Sarsarti Sansar Part 7 Sarsarti Sansar Part 8 Sarsarti Sansar Part 9 Sarsarti Sansar Part 10 These Audio of Sarsarti Sansar are taken from Archive.org which is uploaded by Ujjyalo Network. Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

"Sarsarti Sansar is a light-hearted book that encapsulates my individual experiences and feelings invoked by different places I traveled to. I got to travel to various places during the course of my studies and career. So, in this book, I have tried to capture and condense all the memories of the places." - Jiba Lamichhane Listen Sarsarti Sansar You can listen Sarsarti Sansar in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Sarsarti Sansar. Listen Sarsarti Sansar with Achyut Ghimire from the Radio program Shruti Sambeg. item.title: Saya - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Saaya 1
item.description: Saya - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Who is Saya? To Know about Saya Listen Saya Novel. Why she Left Atit? Where is Saya Now? What happen to Saya? What is the main reason behind that compel Saya to leave Atit? This audio is taken from Youtube. This is not official audio version from Shruti Sambeg. Saya Novel Full Part Listen Saya You can listen Saya in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Saya. Listen Saya with Achyut Ghimire from the Radio program Shruti Sambeg. Full Episodes of Saya To Download Right Click the link and Save link as to your computer Full Episodes of Saya Saaya 1 Saaya 2 Saaya 3 Saaya 4 Saaya 5 Saaya 6 Saaya 7 Saaya 8 Saaya 9 Saaya 10 Saaya 11 These Audio of Sakhee are uploaded by Ujjyalo Network. Some of the queries are unanswered in Nepali Novel Summer Love. Summer Love Novel is written in the dimension of Atit. So there are many suspense left till now. Some questions are there which Atit himself wanted answer. The Saya Novel is taken from Program Parijat. This is full version of Nepali Novel Saya. Listen Saya Novel. Saya Novel By Subin Bhattarai In Summer Love Novel Saya, the lady character was in hibernation. Now in Nepali Novel Saya "The Second part of Summer Love Novel", Saya herself tells her story which is written in the form of Novel named "SAYA". This Nepali Novel Saya also will arise many unanswered question about Atit and Susmita. This Novel Saya is full of Pshychology, sattire and suspense where everyone find themself in the character. Subin Bhattarai is the writer of both Summer Love Novel and Saya (Sequel of Summer Love Novel). Listen Saya Novel Listen Saya Novel in the voice of Achyut Ghimire in radio program Shruti Sambeg. Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

item.description: Saya - Episode 11 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Who is Saya? To Know about Saya Listen Saya Novel. Why she Left Atit? Where is Saya Now? What happen to Saya? What is the main reason behind that compel Saya to leave Atit? This audio is taken from Youtube. This is not official audio version from Shruti Sambeg. Saya Novel Full Part Listen Saya You can listen Saya in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Saya. Listen Saya with Achyut Ghimire from the Radio program Shruti Sambeg. Full Episodes of Saya To Download Right Click the link and Save link as to your computer Full Episodes of Saya Saaya 1 Saaya 2 Saaya 3 Saaya 4 Saaya 5 Saaya 6 Saaya 7 Saaya 8 Saaya 9 Saaya 10 Saaya 11 These Audio of Sakhee are uploaded by Ujjyalo Network. Some of the queries are unanswered in Nepali Novel Summer Love. Summer Love Novel is written in the dimension of Atit. So there are many suspense left till now. Some questions are there which Atit himself wanted answer. The Saya Novel is taken from Program Parijat. This is full version of Nepali Novel Saya. Listen Saya Novel. Saya Novel By Subin Bhattarai In Summer Love Novel Saya, the lady character was in hibernation. Now in Nepali Novel Saya "The Second part of Summer Love Novel", Saya herself tells her story which is written in the form of Novel named "SAYA". This Nepali Novel Saya also will arise many unanswered question about Atit and Susmita. This Novel Saya is full of Pshychology, sattire and suspense where everyone find themself in the character. Subin Bhattarai is the writer of both Summer Love Novel and Saya (Sequel of Summer Love Novel). Listen Saya Novel Listen Saya Novel in the voice of Achyut Ghimire in radio program Shruti Sambeg. Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

item.description: Seto Dharti - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Seto Dharti is Madan Puraskar Winner Nepali Novel written by Amar Neupane. In this Novel, the writer has described the story of the women named Tara who got married at the age of seven and become widow at the age of nine. The flow of the language on novel "Seto Dharti" is so good and Amar Neupane has described the feelings in the heart touching way. You can listen other Novels on Shruti Sambeg. Seto Dharti is Recorded in Audio format by Achyut Ghimire. so listening and downloading audio of Seto Dharti is included here. item.title: Shirish ko Phool - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Shirish Ko Phool - Part 1
item.description: Shirish ko Phool - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Shirish ko Phool is one of the best Nepali Novel of Parijat. Shirish is the beautiful flower, shirish is also known as Mimosa. Parijat originally known as Bishnu Kumari Waiwa is great Nepali Novelist who has won prestigious Madan Puraskar for her great Nepali Novel Shirish ko Phool. Blue Mimosa is the translated version of the novel Shirish ko Phool. Here you can listen this great and famous Nepali Novel from the Radio program Shruti Sambeg on the crystal clear voice of the RJ Achyut Ghimire. Shirish ko Phool | Parijat Parijat originally known as Bishnu Kumari Waiwa is the writer of the novel Shirish Ko Phool. This online Novel shirish ko phool is in audio version and you can listen this novel from the radio program Shruti Sambeg. Shirish Ko Phool Part 1 Shirish Ko Phool Part 2 Shirish Ko Phool Part 3 Shirish Ko Phool Part 4 Shirish Ko Phool Ko Bhumika & story ‘Maile Najanmayeko Chhora’ sirish ko phool and siris ko phool are same. Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

item.title: Soch | Karna Shakya - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Karna Shakya - Part- 1- Nepal Khattam Chaina
item.description: Soch | Karna Shakya - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Soch This Book Soch is written by Karna Shakya. Soch is Self esteem type book. Here is its Audio version. The concept and arrangemen for the audio book was Rabindrasingh Baniya. Soch is in the voice of Laxman Ses and Radhika Baniya , Recording and mixing are done by Bikash Gurung and Binayak Aryal Karna Shakya Karna Shakya, The leading business man and Natural conversationalist of Nepal has written many books. He Is also founder of Kathmandu Guest house of Themal, Kathmandu. Listen Soch by Karna Shakya You can listen Soch by Karna Shakya by clicking play button. item.title: Subarnalata - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Subarnalata Part 1
item.description: Subarnalata - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Subarnalata Novel is written by Malika Keshari. Subarnalate Novel was publish on 2074 from Sangrila Books publication. In this Novel writer Malika Keshari focus on the female condition of present and past. Subarnalata is second novel of Malika keshari. Her first Novel was Punaruthan. This novel is mysterious novel. Listen Nepali novel Subarnalat with crystal clear voice of Achyut Ghimire from Ujyaalo Network program Shruti sambeg. Listen Subarnalata You can listen Subarnalata in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Subarnalata. Listen Subarnalata with Achyut Ghimire from the Radio program Shruti Sambeg. item.title: Taap - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Taap part 1
item.description: Taap - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Novel Taap is written by Sharda Sharma. Taap refers to the power of scorching heat or the power gained from struggle. Another thing is that people learn and experience Taap from the lessons learned from the struggles of their lives, suffering from the supernatural, material and spiritual. As the Taap subsides, people are still gaining energy. That is why it is said that life is struggle, struggle is life. The experiences of a character in the course of his life are the subject matter of a novel. Basically, this novel seeks to highlight various aspects of feminism. As the author is also a woman, the issues of feminism are significant and she has also highlighted the male tendency. The disgusting deeds of a man in a dignified position like a minister are expressed through a novel. Evidence of how inferior a person can be without regard to his position is evident in the novel. Although the author is a woman, she seems to have studied male tendencies very deeply. The important aspect of the novel is that it easily presents the male attitude. We have got the impression that such characters in the recent Nepali political sky also belong to Salva. One of the characters in the novel develops hatred towards people while living, and, the conclusion of those characters towards people is as follows: - 'Perhaps people are animals with the mask of civilization.' It can be done. Sharma's collection of travel essays on 'Land of Flowers' is also excellent. Considering the uniqueness of her writing, Sharma can be counted among the top five women writers in Nepali literature. Listen Taap You can listen Taap in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Taap. Full Episodes of Taap To Download Right Click the link and Save link as to your computer Full Episodes of Taap Taap part 1 Taap part 2 Taap part 3 Taap part 4 Taap part 5 Taap part 6 Taap part 7 Taap part 8 Taap part 9 Taap part 10 Taap part 11 Taap part 12 Taap part 13 Taap part 14 These Audio of Taap are taken from Archive.org which is uploaded by Shrabya Kitab. The novel has been collected in the voice of Pawan Raj Poudel in the program "Sunnelai Sunko Mala". Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

item.title: Taap - Episode 12
item.itunes:subtitle: Taap part 12
item.description: Taap - Episode 12 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Novel Taap is written by Sharda Sharma. Taap refers to the power of scorching heat or the power gained from struggle. Another thing is that people learn and experience Taap from the lessons learned from the struggles of their lives, suffering from the supernatural, material and spiritual. As the Taap subsides, people are still gaining energy. That is why it is said that life is struggle, struggle is life. The experiences of a character in the course of his life are the subject matter of a novel. Basically, this novel seeks to highlight various aspects of feminism. As the author is also a woman, the issues of feminism are significant and she has also highlighted the male tendency. The disgusting deeds of a man in a dignified position like a minister are expressed through a novel. Evidence of how inferior a person can be without regard to his position is evident in the novel. Although the author is a woman, she seems to have studied male tendencies very deeply. The important aspect of the novel is that it easily presents the male attitude. We have got the impression that such characters in the recent Nepali political sky also belong to Salva. One of the characters in the novel develops hatred towards people while living, and, the conclusion of those characters towards people is as follows: - 'Perhaps people are animals with the mask of civilization.' It can be done. Sharma's collection of travel essays on 'Land of Flowers' is also excellent. Considering the uniqueness of her writing, Sharma can be counted among the top five women writers in Nepali literature. Listen Taap You can listen Taap in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Taap. item.title: Tamasuk - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Tamasuk Part 1
item.description: Tamasuk - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Tamasuk, the story collection is written by Padam Vishokarma. Tamasuk was first published in baisakh 2076. The introductory part was written by Maya Thakuri, Nilam Niharika and Gyanu Adhikari. Writer Padam Vishokarma was native of Lamjung, Dhamilekuwa and presently resident of colorado. Writer was student of Tribhuvan University and he studied Major Nepali and Sociology and Anthropology. His Poem collection sabdasuman has been published before. Tamasuk contains many story among them mithai ma bhuleko jindagi are the presented here. Listen Nepali Story collection Tamasuk with Achyut Ghimire from radio program Shruti Sambeg. Listen Tamasuk You can listen Tamasuk in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Tamasuk. item.title: Tribhuvan Ki Erika - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Tribhuvan Ki Erica part 1
item.description: Tribhuvan Ki Erika - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Tribhuvan Ki Erika is translated by Saroj Mishra. The original Nepali translation of the novel "Erika and the King" is "Tribhuvan ki Erika". The author of this novel is Erika Lucatag, who remained a dance instructor of King Tribhuvan in Nepal during the Rana period. This work has been translated from English to Nepali by Saroj Mishra. Listen Tribhuwan ki Erika with Achyut Ghimire from Shruti Sambeg. Moreover you can listen book related to Nepalese Shah Dynasty Novel and book. Listen audio version of Darbar Bahiraki Maharani related to King Mahendra and read book Maile Dekheko Darbar Listen Tribhuvan Ki Erika You can listen Tribhuvan Ki Erica in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Tribhuvan Ki Erica. Full Episodes of Tribhuvan Ki Erica To Download Right Click the link and Save link as to your computer Full Episodes of Tribhuvan Ki Erica Tribhuvan Ki Erica part 1 Tribhuvan Ki Erica part 2 Tribhuvan Ki Erica part 3 Tribhuvan Ki Erica part 4 Tribhuvan Ki Erica part 5 Tribhuvan Ki Erica part 6 Tribhuvan Ki Erica part 7 Tribhuvan Ki Erica part 8 Tribhuvan Ki Erica part 9 Tribhuvan Ki Erica part 10 Tribhuvan Ki Erica part 11 Tribhuvan Ki Erica part 12 Tribhuvan Ki Erica part 13 Tribhuvan Ki Erica part 14 Tribhuvan Ki Erica part 15 Tribhuvan Ki Erica part 16 These Audio of Tribhuvan Ki Erica are taken from Archive.org which is uploaded by Shrabya Kitab. An audio book version of Achyut Ghimire has been collected. The book is about Erika who goes to Nepal to treat the Nepali queens at the time of Tribhuvan. She ends up befriending King Tribhuvan (and teaches him to dance along the way), and helping him to come in contact with the Indian Ambassador, in order for him to flee Nepal and come back and end the Rana regime. Its not a story that most Nepalese know, so I'm sure that if they read it, they will come to know something that they didn't know and would be thankful to the book for telling this lost story. Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

item.description: Urgen ko Ghoda - Episode 5 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Urgen ko Ghoda is written by Yug Pathak. Urgen ko Ghoda is one of the novel written about the Maoist civil war. This book contains story about the people of Nepalese society during the Maoist civil war. Listen Urgen ko Ghoda with Pawan Raj Poudel. This audio version is taken from Radio Thaha Sanchar with radio Program Sunnelai Sunko Mala. Listen Urgen ko Ghoda You can listen Urgen ko Ghoda in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Urgen ko Ghoda. item.itunes:subtitle: Urmila | Nepali Story - Episode 1
item.description: Urmila | Nepali Story - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Urmila is Nepali Story written by Dr. Deenbandhu Sharma. These Nepali stories are published in many Magazines. Nepali Story Urmila is different type of story by Deenbandhu. Urmila is firstly published in Madhuparka in Jestha 2065 in story episode. Listen Nepali Story Urmila Writer Dr. Deenbandhu Sharma described the story of Maira, Larry, Urmila and Laxman. This is audio Story is from Audio books section of this site. This Nepali Story is in audio MP3 format in the voice of Achyut Ghimire. Listen audio book of Nepali story from Ujayaalo 90 Network program Shruti Sambeg. . Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

item.description: Urmila | Surparnkha - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Dr. Deenbhandhu Sharma is the writer of the Nepali Story Urmila and Surparnkha. Urmila is firstly published in Madhuparka in Jestha 2065 in story episode. Listen Urmila Writer Dr. Deenbandhu Sharma described the story of Maira, Larry, Urmila and Laxman. Listen and download Nepali audio story Urmila from Ujaalo 90 network radio program Shruti Sambeg with Achyut Ghimire. Listen Surparnkha Listen and download audio version of Nepali story Surparnkha written by Dr Deenbandhu Sharma. This was firstly published in sahitik patraika "Samasti". This Story describes the character of Surparnkha of ancient religious novel Ramayan. . Download Urmila | Surparnkha Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

item.title: White Cane - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: White Cane part 1
item.description: White Cane - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Nepali Novel White Cane is Written by Manisha Gauchan. The White Cane is a symbol of freedom for the blind. A reflection of free movement. Travel support. Moreover, the support of life. With this cane, I climb countless streets, roads, edges, stairs, stairs. Listen White Cane You can listen White Cane in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen White Cane. Full Episodes of White Cane To Download Right Click the link and Save link as to your computer Full Episodes of White Cane White Cane part 1 White Cane part 2 White Cane part 3 White Cane part 4 White Cane part 5 White Cane part 6 White Cane part 7 White Cane part 8 White Cane part 9 White Cane part 10 White Cane part 11 White Cane part 12 White Cane part 13 White Cane part 14 White Cane part 15 White Cane part 16 White Cane part 17 White Cane part 18 White Cane part 19 White Cane part 20 White Cane part 21 White Cane part 22 White Cane part 23 White Cane part 24 White Cane part 25 White Cane part 26 White Cane part 27 White Cane part 28 White Cane part 29 White Cane part 30 White Cane part 31 White Cane part 32 White Cane part 33 White Cane part 34 White Cane part 35 White Cane part 36 White Cane part 37 White Cane part 38 White Cane part 39 White Cane part 40 White Cane part 41 White Cane part 42 White Cane part 43 White Cane part 44 White Cane part 45 White Cane part 46 White Cane part 47 White Cane part 48 White Cane part 49 White Cane part 50 White Cane part 51 White Cane part 52 These Audio of White Cane are taken from Archive.org which is uploaded by Shrabya Kitab. Writer Gauchan has portrayed the love and life of a born blind character as the main story in the novel. Bhaswat and Sulbha are lovers. They are each other's sources of energy. Surviving the political instability of the country, the turbulent environment, the misery of the people everywhere, Ajit Sulbha chooses these characters to write a novel from the lifestyle of the poor. From which the relationship between them is getting thinner. Later, Sulbha, realizing that her relationship with Bhaswat was impossible due to her real life and experiences, transforms her love affair into a friendship. Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.

item.title: Yunika - Episode 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Yunika part 1
item.description: Yunika - Episode 1 Report issues with episodes at https://github.com/abpaudel/nepali-audiobooks/issues. Dedicated to those who love is a crazy lover's book - 'Unica' novel. This is the first narrative work of Ghanshyam Pathik, a poet and ghazal writer who has made a name for himself in the field of poetry and ghazal. Two collections of ghazals, 'Shahar Timro Bhaye' and 'Bhool Zindagi Ko' and a collection of poems 'Pahelo Phool O Swapna' are the works published before Pathik's novel. Pathik Damak, who is also involved in teaching along with literature, is also a presenter of Pathibhara FM and Himashikhar Television in Jhapa. B.N. Pustak Sansar Pvt Limited is the publisher and editor of the book is Rajkumar Bania. Unika, published in 2072 BS, is priced at Rs. Listen Yunika Novel with Achyut Ghimire from Ujyaalo 90 Network Radio program Shruti sambeg. Listen Yunika You can listen Yunika in Hamro Awaz. Select episode and listen Yunika. Full Episodes of Yunika To Download Right Click the link and Save link as to your computer Full Episodes of Yunika Yunika part 1 Yunika part 2 Yunika part 3 Yunika part 4 Yunika part 5 Yunika part 6 Yunika part 7 Yunika part 8 Yunika part 9 These Audio of Yunika are taken from Archive.org which is uploaded by Shrabya Kitab. The cover of the book is decorated with a picture of a yellow bird flying on a branch of a thorn - by the Fine Art Center. The entire novel, which is divided into 32 parts, has only 258 pages and the last two pages express gratitude on behalf of the author. Inside the last cover is a brief introduction with a picture of the author. Entering the novel, there is another novel within the novel. The author has become a reader and is reading Unika's novel, which has been announced to be awarded the Madan Award. Some works are in the news for a few days after they are published, and some are sold out and sold out. When a work is awarded a prestigious prize, it gains market share and readership. At the beginning of this story I present the character as a reader. As the character I announced the Madan Award for Unika's novel, he decides to read it because the work is popular and starts reading it. In the middle of the story, the love story of Unika and Samik is presented. The beginning of the story is composed in the Purvadipti method and after twenty-eight episodes, the story is re-arranged and moved forward. Seen in this way, it seems that this novel has been composed in a mixed format. The original story is in the middle. Dedicated to those who love, it is easy to understand that this work is based on a love story. In the sixties, when the development of social media was not as fast as it is now and the exchange of messages and phone conversations between boyfriends and girlfriends through mobile phones, the situation of that time is also reflected in the story. The author has advanced the ups and downs of love in a series of ways. In the middle of the story, he has also inserted his ghazal personality according to the context - by mentioning the lions of ghazal. The author presents the moment of reunion and separation in a way that makes the reader happy and sad. In the last part of the story, I read that the character's own love story is a popular novel and its real author is a friend of Samik, but the story of Unika ends with the fact that others have taken advantage of it. In the novel, Unika is the main female character and Samik is the main male character. Their love is connecting and breaking up three times. After falling in love for the third time, Samik left the capital and reached Jhapa and started living a well-organized life in Jhapa. Between Unika and Samik, sometimes the landlord, sometimes the younger (Unika's sister) seems to be present. After going to Jhapa, the love of Unika and Samik grows once again. They get ready to get married and when the father does not approve of the marriage, the love breaks down again. In this way, both the characters seem to be accepting the ups and downs of reunion and separation with the situation. In the end, Samik arrives in Kathmandu to fight the last battle for his love. After many attempts to talk to Unika but failed, the story ends with Unika's flower being with another boy that Unika likes. In the last part of the story, I read that the character's own love story is a famous novel and its real author is a friend of Samik's, but the story of Unika ends with the fact that others have taken advantage of it. Originally written from a first-person perspective, the language of the novel is very simple and communicative. Although the work is called 'Buckpatra of a mad lover', it is not only Samik's one-sided presentation here, a lot of things have been said about him through Unika, but also an attempt has been made to present Unika's thoughts a little through the entrance. But what did she really think on behalf of Unica in this love story? Why play such a game? As it is incomplete, it is limited to one-sided expression. Here it seems that the author has not been able to present both the characters with justice. The surroundings of this story are Maiti Devi, Ghattekulo, Kalimati, Kuleshwor, Swayambhu, Balaju, Godavari, etc. of Kathmandu, while Birtamod and Charali of Jhapa are also included. It seems that the lifestyle of the youths living and studying in Kathmandu is also tried to be included in this story. Although there is no explanation of the wholeness of life, this work has got the full form of the novel. Episode description/links courtesy of https://hamroawaz.blogspot.com.
